translation.ko: 어머니가 술과 진통제에 중독된 걸 몰랐어요

translation.en: because that's all I'd ever known.
translation.ko: 제가 아는 어머니의 모습은 항상 그랬으니까요

translation.en: I had to be the person who did everything
'cause my mother wouldn't go out of the house.
I had to go to the pharmacist and convince him to give me more Valium
'cause she lost her bottle of Valium,
never even thinking that she was just taking more and more of the stuff.
translation.ko: 복용량이 늘고 있다는 걸 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: And she developed a dependency upon me.
When I was going off to college,
she did everything she could to kind of stop that.
translation.ko: 어머니는 절 막기 위해 모든 수단을 동원했어요

translation.en: Not 'cause she didn't want me to go to college,
but she didn't wanna lose me.
So, she got more violent, and, uh, she's only 5'1",
but she would come down, grab my hair, and smash me against the wall,
translation.ko: 제 머리를 쥐어뜯고 저를 벽에다 밀쳤어요

translation.en: or she'd tell me I was lying about something,
pour liquid soap down my throat till I threw up, just some crazy shit.
translation.ko: 토할 때까지 제 목에 물비누를 들이부었어요

translation.en: But I don't wanna malign her because I wouldn't be who I am without my mom.
translation.ko: 비난하고 싶진 않아요 그분 없인 지금의 전 없었겠죠

translation.en: It made me become a practical psychologist.
I mean, I had to figure out how to keep her stable,
how to make sure my brother and sister weren't affected by it, how to please her.
translation.ko: 형제한테 영향을 주지 않고 어머니를 기쁘게 하는 방법도요

translation.en: It made me a pleaser in the early part of my life, for sure.
translation.ko: 그래서 전 어릴 때 남을 기쁘게 하는 사람이 됐죠

translation.en: And I think--
I don't know, it... it...
It produced in me... drive
because I had to find a way
to have a life that wasn't gonna be like that for my family.
translation.ko: 과거와 다른 인생을 살 방법을 찾아야 했거든요

translation.en: Now, here's what we're gonna do.
Raise your hand if you're really fucked up.
translation.ko: 자신이 망가졌다고 생각하면 손을 들어 봐요

translation.en: Okay, one really fucked up, two really fucked up...
So many fucked up choices.
No, now I know who I'm not gonna call on.
All the people that want attention. No, you're all fucking dead.
Now I know who you are, none of you.
I'd really like to, sincerely, bring somebody up who is suicidal.
translation.ko: 자살 충동을 느낀 사람 얘기를 해볼게요

translation.en: And I know you're out there simply because in a room of 2,500 people, on average,
translation.ko: 2,500명이 있는 방에서 자살 충동을 느끼는 사람은

translation.en: there's 12 people that are suicidal.
So now would be the chance for you to handle this shit,
so you don't have to live with that anymore.
So, if you're suicidal, stand up.
translation.ko: 자살 충동을 느낀 분들은 일어나 주세요

translation.en: Okay, give these people a hand, they're suicidal, for God sakes.
Hi.
What's your name?
Um, Dawn.
You're just checking your name tag to know whether it was Dawn or not?
translation.ko: 던이 맞나 확인하려면 이름표를 봐야 해요?

translation.en: 'Cause in Brazil, they call me Sol.
Oh, really? What does it mean, Sol?
-Sun. -Sun.
What's a sun that wants to kill itself?
Well, actually I'm a sun for everyone else.
translation.ko: 사실 저는 저 말고 남들에게 태양이었어요 "던"

translation.en: -I see. -[sobbing] But...
no one really knows, really, what's inside me. [sniffles]
translation.ko: 제 안에 뭐가 있는지 아무도 몰랐어요

translation.en: And when I came here, I said, "I'm not gonna fake it anymore."
translation.ko: 이곳에 왔을 때 더는 속이지 않겠다고 다짐했죠

translation.en: Good. You know I wouldn't accept that anyway.
translation.ko: 잘됐네요, 전 그런 걸 용납 못 하거든요

translation.en: So, tell me, what's going on in there?
Well... [exhales]
I'm just...
I'm tired of having so much pain and carrying it for so many years.
translation.ko: 너무 오랜 세월 고통당하는 데 질렸어요

translation.en: -How old are you? -Twenty-six.
Oh, give me a break.
You could take another 30 years of this shit.
You're not that fucking weak. Don't tell me that shit.
translation.ko: 당신은 그렇게 약하지 않아요 말도 안 되는 소리 말아요

translation.en: I don't want you to, but you sure as hell could.
translation.ko: 힘들길 바란다는 게 아니라 당신은 진짜 견딜 수 있어요

translation.en: Don't lie to fucking me. You and I are gonna have some truth.
If you're gonna tell me what's really going on, we're gonna have truth.
translation.ko: 무슨 일인지 말하면 진실을 알게 될 거예요

translation.en: -Is that fair? -Yeah, you wanna hear it?
-Yes, I wanna hear it. Tell me. -Okay.
I was born in a community called the Children of God.
[sobbing] I don't know if you ever heard of it.
But as we're born, we never had a chance to choose who we wanted to be.
translation.ko: 우린 어떤 사람이 될지 선택할 수가 없어요

translation.en: We were kids growing up
and we had to be children... soldiers of God.
And they believed that love, God's love, was sex.
So everyone had to give their love through sex,
translation.ko: 모두가 성관계를 통해 사랑을 줘야 했죠

translation.en: so everyone, since we were six years old,
to give God's love, you had to have sex with people,
translation.ko: 신의 사랑을 주기 위해 성관계를 해야 하고

translation.en: and see your mother and your brothers... everyone being abused.
translation.ko: 엄마랑 형제가 학대받는 걸 봐야 해요

translation.en: And you grow up...
already knowing that you don't have a life.
You have to be a vessel of "God's love,"
and you can't... you can't have any own choices.
So, as the time passed, when I was 12, I said, "I cannot handle this."
translation.ko: 12살이 됐을 때 전 못 하겠다고 말했어요

translation.en: I believe that there's love, and this is not it.
translation.ko: 사랑을 믿지만 그런 건 아니라고 생각했어요

translation.en: I haven't found one model that I can look at and say, "That is real."
translation.ko: 그게 진짜라는 증거를 찾을 수가 없었어요

translation.en: So, I had my own vision of God,
even though I was grown up with visions of a totally disgusting God,
translation.ko: 날 겁탈하고 끔찍한 짓을 하길 원하는

translation.en: a Jesus that wanted to fuck you, that wanted to do horrible things with you.
But I said, "I believe in something else even if I never saw it."
translation.ko: 보진 못했지만 다른 세상이 있다고 믿었어요

translation.en: But then, I've been trying to construct myself,
but when I see all of my family,
like, they're all depressed, they all wanna kill themselves.
My brother's a huge mess. My mom is a huge mess.
And, like, they would never believe if I stand up-- "She's suicidal? No."
translation.ko: 제가 죽고 싶다고 말해도 가족들은 믿지 않을걸요

translation.en: I'm the one that takes care of everybody.
And I'm always there, positive,
and I'm always there trying to do everything to help them and to coach them,
and say, "No, everything's gonna be okay,"
and I'm like the solution-maker in my family.
But I just came to a point that I don't know what to do with so much pain,
translation.ko: 하지만 이제 이 고통을 어떻게 해야 할지 모르겠어요

translation.en: and I don't know...
I'm 26 and I've never had a relationship. I don't know what love is.
One of my friends said,
"I know a guy called Tony. He's a great guy." [chuckles]
A miracle.
You're truly a miracle.
To have made it through that
and be here in this moment, you're a miracle to everyone in this room.
translation.ko: 이 순간에 여기 와서 사람들에게 기적을 보여 줬어요

translation.en: And that's one thing I know.
Out of insane... insanity, out of pain, [sniffles]
out of injustice...
You've not been through pain. You've been through spiritual pain.
translation.ko: 그냥 고통이 아니라 정신적인 고통을 당했어요

translation.en: It's beyond what most people could ever imagine in their lives.
You haven't deserved any of it.
[sniffles] But out of that...
comes unbelievable fucking strength.
translation.ko: 당신은 믿을 수 없이 강한 힘을 얻었어요

translation.en: And you're tired of being strong...
but you still are.
You've been trying to make sense of all this.
And there is no sense.
And that's made you the most crazy.
But how there's gonna be sense in this is...
you are gonna make sure that this stops with you.
With you, it stops.
And love begins, real love begins.
And that love is all you really are made of.
That's why you made it through it.
You are the purest.
You wanna know what love is, it's called you.
translation.ko: 사랑이 뭔지 알고 싶어 하죠 당신이 사랑이에요

translation.en: You made it through all that shit with pure love, that's what it is.
-[audience cheering] -Pure love.
Your love is... You're incredible.
You're incredible.
I love you.
I love you. I don't want you. I love you.
translation.ko: 당신을 원하는 게 아니라 사랑하는 거예요

translation.en: I'm able to do what I do because of all I've been through.
translation.ko: 내가 지금 이런 사람이 된 건 내가 겪은 모든 일들 덕이에요

translation.en: And I don't talk about and go into details of it
'cause why go through the story?
But there's no way I would care this much
unless I've felt feelings [sniffling] that are similar to your own.
And what I can tell you is...
because I've been through that, I have fucking muscle and strength.
translation.ko: 그걸 이겨냈기 때문에 강한 힘을 얻었다는 거예요

translation.en: I have a spiritual strength in me just like you do,
and because of that, I can reach anyone.
I've gone to the darkest, scariest places, [sniffles]
translation.ko: 난 가장 어둡고 두려운 곳을 경험했기에

translation.en: and because of that, I can lift people to the highest places.
translation.ko: 가장 높은 곳으로 사람들을 이끌 수 있어요

translation.en: And you have that gift.
And that gift is being born today, right fucking now,
with some new choices of what's gonna happen.
That's what's happening right now.
You were put in a situation where you weren't able to choose.
Now you're in the position where you choose.
You take all the power back today.
You consciously decide.
And here's the cool thing.
You've already fucking decided. You just looked for the moment.
translation.ko: 당신은 이미 결정했고 그 순간을 찾았다는 거예요

translation.en: And I know you wanted a place that was safe.
And I know you want a place where there'd be love,
and you picked the right place.
Do me a favor. Step up on your chair so you can see.
And I want-- I want you...
Really look. Take it in.
Look at the... Look at the number of people.
Really look.
Stop and grab as many gazes as you can.
There's men out there that are just sending you love,
translation.ko: 저쪽에 있는 사람들이 당신한테 사랑을 보내네요

translation.en: and that's all they want, is to send you love.
Just find a few of them that, when you look in their eyes,
translation.ko: 몇 명을 찾아서 그들의 눈빛을 봐요

translation.en: you know that they're not only safe,
but they really are sending you love and there's no agenda.
translation.ko: 아무런 의도 없이 당신에게 사랑을 주죠

translation.en: I have a hard time believing in that.
I know, but I want you to look in their eyes
and find the three that you know is true.
translation.ko: 진실이라고 느껴지는 사람 세 명을 골라요

translation.en: -[chuckles] Him. -Him?
Okay, there's one.
-Him? [chuckles] -[chuckles]
Stand up. There he is. Here's another one right here.
He was--
He was sweet with me
translation.ko: 제가 앉아서 무서운 표정을 하고 있는데도

translation.en: even though I had a horrible face and was sitting down here,
and everyone was thinking, "That girl is in a really bad mood,
translation.ko: 기분이 안 좋아서 말을 안 하는 거라고

translation.en: she's not interacting,"
and he was there talking to me and being sweet.
translation.ko: 저분은 제게 와서 다정하게 말을 걸었어요

translation.en: -Yes. He's sincere isn't he? -Yeah.
I need one more.
Him.
-Come on up here. -[audience cheering]
So I'm gonna ask if you, you and you
will become her new uncles,
the ones that she can trust for the next ten years of her life.
translation.ko: 앞으로 10년간 던이 믿을 수 있는 사람요

translation.en: And the form of that is really simple.
For the next six months,
you connect to her at least once a month for a few minutes.
Just see how she's doing, be there for her, support her,
and give her anything that you're capable of doing that she asks.
translation.ko: 여러분이 할 수 있는 걸 던에게 해주세요

translation.en: And better yet, if you're a great uncle,
you anticipate what she might need and you deliver it before she asks.
translation.ko: 던이 말하기 전에 먼저 챙겨 주겠죠

translation.en: The value for you in this transaction--
And I need to tell you 'cause you were pulled here, you were chosen.
You chose yourself.
And something inside of you was pulled to let her know how loved she is.
translation.ko: 여러분 내면의 뭔가가 던에게 사랑을 줬어요

translation.en: And this is what you were made for.
You were made to love unconditionally.
And the more we do...
the more we experience the "human" in humanity.
translation.ko: 인간다운 아름다움을 많이 경험하게 될 거예요

translation.en: We experience our true nature...
and we feel deeply alive.
So here's what we're gonna do.
If you want...
I have a partner,
and she's considered one of the greatest family therapists, strategists in the world,
translation.ko: 이 세상에서 가장 훌륭한 가족 전략가예요

translation.en: and her name is Cloé Madanes.
And what I'm gonna do with you, if you want,
is I'm gonna put you through that training
so that you have every talent I have to be able to help anyone.
translation.ko: 남을 도울 수 있는 재능이 당신한테도 있거든요

translation.en: Okay? Now, are you up for that?
Yes.
-Okay? -Yes.
You'll learn the principles behind what I do.
translation.ko: 내가 하는 일에 대한 원칙을 배울 거예요

translation.en: You won't be a copy of me. You'll be you, which'll be more powerful.
translation.ko: 날 따라 하는 게 아니라 당신 스스로, 더 강력하게요

translation.en: And you have a life experience on top of the skill, you have a caring.
translation.ko: 당신은 경험과 기술이 있고 배려심도 있어요

translation.en: My power is my caring. My power is my love.
My power is I can pierce anything 'cause I am the real fucking thing,
translation.ko: 내 힘은 뭐든지 꿰뚫어요 난 진짜거든요

translation.en: and so are you.
And that real thing can get through to anybody
if you care enough and you're persistent enough.
But I also develop strategies and I'll teach them all to you.
translation.ko: 하지만 나도 전략을 배웠으니 당신한테도 가르쳐 줄게요

translation.en: -Thank you so much. -All right?
-Okay. -So much.
You don't know how important that is to me. Thank you.
translation.ko: 이 기회가 얼마나 소중한지 토니는 모를 거예요, 감사해요

translation.en: [Joe] Tony, what happens in that moment with you?
translation.ko: 토니, 그 순간에 무슨 일이 일어난 거죠?

translation.en: [Tony] I just felt her, and felt for her...
and knew something had to be done now.
And in my mind, I said,
"What the fuck do you do with all this?"
This is... inhuman what was done to her.
And I just said, "There is a way." And it...
It just comes through me.
Nothing genius there. [sniffles]
I've never dealt with this issue, obviously, or anything like this, but...
I just decide and I know it's done.
And then it comes out.
It's beautiful to experience and witness.
I just really believe people's, uh, love and caring.
If they led with that, they'd find the way.
translation.ko: 사랑과 배려가 있으면 길을 찾을 수 있어요

translation.en: I think they lead with their fear they're gonna fail, and I will not fail.
translation.ko: 두려움이 있으면 실패해요 전 실패하지 않을 거예요

translation.en: [stammers] Not a person in that situation.
translation.ko: 그런 상황에 부닥친 사람을 버려둘 순 없어요

translation.en: It's not an option. [sniffles]
Under any circumstances.
I know if she's there, she's come to this moment.
translation.ko: 전 던에게 그런 순간이 올 줄 알았어요

translation.en: She's come to this moment for a reason, and I will not fail her.
translation.ko: 거기엔 다 이유가 있는 거니 전 포기할 수 없습니다

translation.en: It's suffering in my own life
that makes me not let anybody else suffer that I can possibly do something about.
translation.ko: 할 수만 있다면 다른 사람들은 고통당하지 않게 하고 싶어요

translation.en: And I love to see people light up,
but I will not let them stay in suffering if I can humanly do anything.
[Joe] But that doesn't tell me why.
[Tony] 'Cause I know what it feels like, and I don't want anyone to feel that way.
translation.ko: 그 심정을 아니까 그걸 겪게 하긴 싫어요

translation.en: [Joe] I had a difficult childhood. I've suffered.
You know, I don't have that capacity.
It's my obsession.
It's an obsession.
It's obsession to break through. It's an obsession to help.
translation.ko: 이겨내야 한다는 강박 도와야 한다는 강박

translation.en: I'm addicted to it. It makes me feel like, um...
translation.ko: 전 그거에 중독됐어요 그래야 제 기분이...

translation.en: my life has deep meaning, not just surface meaning.
translation.ko: 제 인생이 의미 있고 가볍지 않게 느껴지거든요

translation.en: And everybody's got their thing, and this is my thing.
translation.ko: 누구에게나 목표가 있는데 그게 제 목표예요

translation.en: [interviewer] Coming to "Date With Destiny," what was it
that you were seeking or looking to explore about yourself or about life
that brought you here?
One of my limiting beliefs was
translation.ko: 제 짧은 소견으로 볼 때 전 사교성이 별로였죠

translation.en: that I'm just not very good with people and I don't make good first impressions
translation.ko: 제 짧은 소견으로 볼 때 전 사교성이 별로였죠 그리고 첫인상도 안 좋아서

translation.en: and I have a really hard time connecting with people,
and that was the story that's been playing out for decades.
And what I realized is that I love connecting with people.
translation.ko: 사실은 사람들과 어울리기 좋아한다는 걸 깨달았어요

translation.en: [interviewer] So that's interesting because, here, it brings you to "Date With Destiny"
where someone is asked to pick people out of a crowd of 2,500 people. [laughs]
translation.ko: 2,500명 중에 몇 사람을 뽑으라는 얘기가 나왔잖아요

translation.en: -Yeah. -And, uh, you know, a first impression...
Yeah, you know, I never really-- That's a pretty amazing thing.
translation.ko: 네, 상상도 못 한... 놀라운 일이에요

translation.en: [Dawn] Thank you.
You guys did great. Thank you.
-I love you. -[Dawn] I love you, too.
-There you are, my third uncle. -[chuckles]
Thank you.
-Enjoy. You're gonna enjoy. Take care. -Thank you
I'll see you downstairs.
[Dawn] In that moment, it was just such loving energy in that room,
translation.ko: 그 순간에 방 안에 사랑스러운 에너지가 있었고

translation.en: and I just saw their loving faces.
It's super hard nowadays
to really look at someone and believe that it's real, what they feel.
translation.ko: 다른 사람의 감정이 진짜인지 믿기 어렵잖아요

translation.en: And at that moment, I didn't ask twice. I just knew it was real.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 순간에 전 알았어요 진짜란 게 느껴졌어요

translation.en: So that was very liberating for me, too.
[crew member] Thank you very much.
-Thank you. -I really appreciate it.
[Julianne Hough] Hi. [Dawn] Hi.
-How are you? -Two awesome ladies.
-I'm good. And you? -Wonderful.
-How do you feel today? -Amazing.
-Yeah. -Amazing.
Well, I know all of us feel amazing, too. Thank you so much for sharing your story.
It gave so much, um, light in all of our lives.
The thing that got me was that...
I was sobbing uncontrollably, not because--
I mean, I was because of the pain that you'd gone through,
-but because of the strength that you had. -Mmm.
And it touched something inside of me
because of certain things that happened in my life, in my past,
not to your extent,
but, um, that I've had to go through and let go of as well.
And I came here last year and that... that set me free.
-Yeah. -And I'm so able to love now.
And I'm able to receive love.
And it's the greatest gift on the planet, so...
-You are so loved. -[chuckles]
To me, what was just so inspiring is that you had the courage
translation.ko: 제가 감동했던 건 당신이 너무 용감하게도

translation.en: to get up and speak about something that is so unfathomable to all of us.
translation.ko: "마리아 메노우노스 TV 사회자" 상상도 안 갈 정도로 힘든 일을 얘기했다는 거예요

translation.en: Oh, my God, I can't.

And I was looking at him like he was crazy.
And he said, "I know more about your life, Mr. Robbins,
than you probably think I do or you think anybody does.
I know about your home life." I'm looking at him like, "What?"
translation.ko: '네 가정생활도 알아' 그게 무슨 말인지 되묻자

translation.en: And he goes, "I wanted you to read this."
And he hands me this speech and it was called The Will to Win.
And he said, "Just read it.
If it's not your life, give it back to me and forget about it.
But if I've pegged you right, then that speech is you.
translation.ko: '하지만 내 생각이 맞으면 이 얘기는 네 얘기야'

translation.en: And I want you to go compete at this regional final in persuasive oratory."
translation.ko: '설득력 있는 웅변으로 지역 대회에 나가 봐라'

translation.en: To my leadership, it feels so incredible that I can go full force into that room
translation.ko: 제 리더십으로 그 방을 채울 수 있다는 게 놀라워요

translation.en: and I know that there are gonna be some people
that are gonna need that individual attention,
and that you guys will grab 'em and be on top of it,
translation.ko: 여러분은 그들과 함께 정상에 오를 거예요

translation.en: and I think that's the gift of this community we've built here
translation.ko: 우리가 만든 공동체의 선물이 바로 그거예요

translation.en: is we've raised the standard for caring.
And I read the speech and I cried my eyes out.
And it was all about, um...
just never ever, ever, ever giving up.
Just pure will is what keeps you going.
translation.ko: 순수한 의지만 있으면 계속할 수 있다고요

translation.en: At that stage of my life, that's all it was, was pure will.
And, um, so I read that thing. I said, "This is me,"
translation.ko: 그걸 읽었을 때 제 얘기라고 생각했어요

translation.en: and I got up and I went to this regional competition,
and I trounced everybody. I won first place.
And I went to another one, and I won first place, another one, first place.
-Let's grab a picture right here. -[Tony] It was a
breakthrough because I began to realize I had a way I can reach people.
So, I'm deeply touched and I'm very grateful.
Thank you for being my partners and creating another magnificent event
translation.ko: 멋진 세미나를 만들어 준 파트너 여러분께 감사해요

translation.en: that those human beings will never be the same again.
-Thank you so much. See you all back. -Thank you. Thank you.
[Joe] Why is it still an emotional experience for you to even tell that story?
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 하면 여전히 뭉클한 이유가 뭔가요?

translation.en: Because I see that as a moment of grace.
That man, you know, in my life,
handing me that letter, seeing who I was in that moment,
translation.ko: 건네주신 편지를 보고 제가 누군지 깨닫는 게

translation.en: that was grace.
There's a lot I've done, but that was grace.
Um, I didn't create that.
And so, while I've done my part to sculpt who I am,
and I've done a hell of a lot about that to say the least,
translation.ko: 많은 노력을 했지만 그건 별것 아니고

translation.en: and it never ends for me.
I also recognize [sputters] grace.
So it's a connection to the divine,
a connection to know that it's more than you,
and I think that's a healthy thing.
Sometimes in life...
we're wanting to make steps forward
but there seems to be something pulling us back.
The human consciousness is an interesting device
in that the brain is learning all the time.
And the brain's primary job is to make sure you survive,
translation.ko: 뇌의 주요 역할은 우릴 생존시키는 거예요

translation.en: so it's always looking what to protect you from.
And very often in life, we have an experience,
and we react to that experience.
It's like a muscle contracting.
But then we keep it contracted. We never, once it's safe, let go again.
translation.ko: 하지만 계속 수축하죠 우린 안전한 걸 놓지 않거든요

translation.en: And it limits what we can experience in our life.
Freud figured out that if we could go back to before the moment,
translation.ko: 프로이트에 따르면 우리가 어떤 순간 이전으로 돌아가면

translation.en: it could heal the moment that was holding you
'cause you'd forgotten something that would make you let go.
So, I'm gonna take you through an experience of doing that
translation.ko: 전 여러분이 이런 과정을 겪게 할 거예요

translation.en: and this process, you don't have to understand it.
This is a journey you're gonna go on.
You'll remember certain things.
And as you remember them,
you can make some new decisions about what they mean
translation.ko: 새롭게 결정할 수 있어요 그들이 어떤 의미이고

translation.en: and how it might mean a new life to you.
I'm wondering what your earliest memory is.
Where were you?
What were you experiencing?
What did it mean?
What did you decide back then?
It's a decision that affected the way you think about life.
translation.ko: 그 결정으로 인해 인생에 대한 시각이 달라져요

translation.en: Okay, now lights down, and we'll do our breath.
We're gonna rise up with our hands,
but as you do it, you're taking the breath in.
Stop. Stop.
Hands relaxed. Palms face up, relaxed.
translation.ko: 손을 내리고 손바닥을 위로 향하게 놔요

translation.en: Feel your body.
Feel how your breath has calmed your mind.
translation.ko: 자신의 호흡이 마음을 진정시키는 걸 느껴요

translation.en: With your eyes remaining closed,
put both your hands on your heart and breathe deep into your heart.
translation.ko: 두 손을 심장에 놓고 깊이 숨을 쉬어요

translation.en: Breathe in your heart and feel the strength of your heart.
translation.ko: 가슴으로 숨 쉬고 심장의 힘을 느껴요

translation.en: Feel grateful for the gift of your heart.
For as long as it beats, you live.
translation.ko: 심장이 뛰는 한 우린 계속 살 수 있어요

translation.en: I want you to think of three moments in your life
that you could feel deeply grateful for if you wanted to.
Just go on a journey of one moment after the other of gratitude.
You may feel a hand touch your head.
translation.ko: 이마를 만지는 손길을 느낄 수도 있어요

translation.en: If it does, just keep in the state you're in and intensify.
translation.ko: 만약 그렇다면 그 상태에서 더 깊이 빠져들어요

translation.en: If it doesn't, you'll still feel the energy.
translation.ko: 그게 안 느껴진다 해도 에너지는 느껴질 거예요

translation.en: It'll be in you.
[Tony] Really go for it.
Step in the moment, like you're there, looking through your own eyes,
translation.ko: 자기 시선으로 보면서 그 순간에 집중하세요

translation.en: seeing what you saw then, feeling what you felt then,
translation.ko: 자기가 봤던 걸 보고 느꼈던 걸 느껴요

translation.en: appreciating...
[Tony] Feeling the blessing of that moment.
What a blessing it was in your life, how grateful you are.
translation.ko: 여러분 삶이 얼마나 은혜롭고 얼마나 감사한지요

translation.en: Take in the gratitude of that moment.
Feel it.
Feel what it led to that you feel so grateful for.
translation.ko: 감사함을 느끼도록 이끈 게 뭔지 느껴요

translation.en: That it was a blessing.
In a few moments, you'll open your eyes, feeling integrated, feeling strong...
translation.ko: 잠시 후 눈을 뜨면 통합되고 강해졌으며

translation.en: feeling like a healing, feeling filled with gratitude,
translation.ko: 뭔가 치료되고 감사한 기분을 느낄 거예요

translation.en: wanting to stretch, to strengthen and to feel fully alive,
translation.ko: 손을 뻗고 싶고 강해지고 싶고 전보다 더

translation.en: more than ever,
feeling at one with yourself and one with life.
translation.ko: 나 자신과 하나 되고 인생과 하나 된 느낌일 겁니다

translation.en: Where an energy will come through you
and you can celebrate that with your voice in that moment.
translation.ko: 그 순간에 여러분의 목소리로 축복하는 거예요

translation.en: Get ready.
Open your eyes whenever you're ready.
And when you want, you can stand...
and you can begin to stretch,
and you can feel the energy build inside you.
Let it build.
And then make a sound of total joy, total excitement.
One, two, three, go!
Feel the guidance that never leaves us.
Take everything in here so you can take it home forever.
Breathe it, feel it, own it, tonight and every night.
translation.ko: 숨 쉬고 느끼고 소유해요 오늘 밤과 앞으로도요

translation.en: You take the greatest gifts of all home, who you've become,
translation.ko: 여러분이 어떤 사람이 됐고 어떤 선택을 했는지가

translation.en: the choices you've made,
the strength, the love, the commitment in your heart.
translation.ko: 여러분 마음속에 있는 힘, 사랑, 약속이죠

translation.en: And the sound will always bring you back to this moment.
translation.ko: 이 음악이 여러분을 늘 이 순간으로 데려올 거예요

translation.en: One, two, three! Make the sound of who you are!
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋! 자신이 누구인지 소리 질러요!

translation.en: We've been on a little journey.
It wasn't a trip.
A trip is predictable. A trip is boring.
A journey has all kinds of discoveries, doesn't it?
Did you discover some new friends?
Did you discover some new feelings?
Did you discover a new you?
So, just for a moment,
think about if you go to a great concert, what are you looking to feel?
translation.ko: 훌륭한 콘서트에 가면 어떤 기분일지 생각해봐요

translation.en: Fully alive, isn't it?
Here, you were the concert.
The concert was a family of people from 71 countries
who came together to create music, magic, a transformation.
translation.ko: 그들이 음악과 마법을 창조했고 변화를 만들었어요

translation.en: We brought our desire, our hunger, our love, our caring,
translation.ko: 우리는 욕망, 배고픔 사랑과 배려를 챙기고

translation.en: and we left our fear, our limitations, our frustration
translation.ko: 공포, 한계, 좌절을 버리고 갈 거예요

translation.en: and our fucking past behind.
That's what we did here, ladies and gentlemen.
translation.ko: 여기서 우리가 한 일이 바로 그겁니다

translation.en: It's been a privilege to serve you.
We've laughed, we've cried, we've broken through.
It was a blind date with destiny. How did she turn out, that date, for you?
Until we meet again, hopefully soon,
make your life a masterpiece, my dear friends. God bless you.
translation.ko: 인생을 걸작으로 만드세요 신의 은총이 함께하기를

translation.en: [Dawn] This whole week here and "Date With Destiny"
was just a confirmation that by expressing myself
and just not being afraid to be judged or, you know, to let that out,
translation.ko: 나 자신을 표현함으로써 얻는 확신 같은 거였어요

translation.en: it touched so many people.
So, that's what I wanna do for the rest of my life, and I don't wanna have fear.
translation.ko: 남은 인생을 그렇게 살 거예요 두려워할 필요가 없죠

translation.en: I wanna let that shine. And so I'm excited about that. [chuckles]
[Matyas] It meant a lot to me, the support of other people.
translation.ko: 다른 사람의 응원이 저한텐 큰 의미였어요

translation.en: There was a point when I felt, uh,
"Yeah, I can trust. I'm in the right place."
[Hali] Everybody wants to know what happened after the call.
translation.ko: 그 통화 이후에 어떻게 됐는지 다들 궁금해하더라고요

translation.en: I feel like I came in here and I had the weight of the world with me,
translation.ko: 전 이곳에 와서 세상의 무게를 느낀 것 같아요

translation.en: and I feel like I set it down and I don't wanna pick it back up.
translation.ko: 그걸 내려놨으니 다시 들고 싶지 않아요

translation.en: Pretty much after I contacted my dad, I was able to stay in contact with him.
translation.ko: 아빠한테 연락하고 나서 주기적으로 안부를 묻고 있어요

translation.en: We've been texting and talking to each other every day.
I think everything in my life will just be a lot better.
translation.ko: 제 인생의 모든 게 더 좋아질 거예요

translation.en: I'll see my dad a lot more.
I definitely want him to be a big part of my life again.
translation.ko: 아빠가 다시 제 인생의 큰 부분을 차지하겠죠

translation.en: [Lance] Knowing that she's got my back now,
we can push forward and conquer our dreams,
translation.ko: 우린 함께 나아가고 꿈을 정복할 수 있어요

translation.en: and it's just amazing.
[Tammi] I mean, it makes me so happy
because now I get to choose the stuff that makes me light up.
translation.ko: 제가 좋아하는 걸 선택할 수 있거든요

translation.en: [Tony] The idea that I can start a chain reaction of transformation
translation.ko: 사람들이 한 명씩 방법을 전수하다 보면

translation.en: where people-- each one teach one.
translation.ko: 변화의 연쇄 반응을 일으킬 수 있어요

translation.en: You know, I can teach them and they go teach someone else.
translation.ko: 제가 그들에게 가르치면 그들이 남을 가르치는 거죠

translation.en: When I think about the families who were touched by this week,
translation.ko: 이번 주에 감동받은 가족을 생각할 때

translation.en: when I think about the businesses and employees,
that makes the whole thing worthwhile.
[Joe] What do you hope that this film will capture?
translation.ko: 이 영상을 통해 토니가 바라는 건 뭐죠?

translation.en: [Tony] My hope is that maybe somebody will watch this film and say, "Oh, wow.
translation.ko: 제가 바라는 건 누군가 이걸 보고

translation.en: It was really beautiful to watch these people transform."
translation.ko: 사람들이 변화하는 게 아름답다고 말해주는 거예요

translation.en: Just watch it for that,
and maybe that'll make them think about what's possible for themselves.
[Joe] What about giving people a better understanding of who Tony Robbins is?
translation.ko: 토니 로빈스가 누군지도 잘 알게 될까요?

translation.en: I don't know that many people give a shit. [laughing]
Honestly, if that's what your film's success is based on, I think you're in trouble.
I think it's gotta be based on something bigger than that.
translation.ko: 이건 더 큰 목적으로 만들어질 거잖아요

translation.en: I think it's gotta be based on what makes human beings fulfilled,
translation.ko: 이 영상의 목적은 무엇이 인간을 충족시키고

translation.en: what makes them alive, what makes them hungry,
what makes them change.
You know, we all know that change can happen in a moment,
translation.ko: 순식간에 변화할 수 있다는 건 다들 알지만

translation.en: but we're afraid it won't last.
How is it that people can make lasting changes in minutes?
translation.ko: '영원히 지속되는 변화가 왜 몇 분 만에 생기는 걸까?'

translation.en: What makes that possible, and is it really real?
And can I taste it and feel it, and could I experience it myself?
translation.ko: '내가 겪고 느낄 수 있을까? 직접 경험할 수 있을까?'

translation.en: I think that's a hell of a lot more interesting than, you know, Tony Robbins.
translation.ko: 그런 게 토니 로빈스보다 더 재미있을 거예요
